content:
Oh God! This phrase "contain an anagram" suggests heavily that the strings must contain a consecutive set of letters that form anagram, while the opposite information is hidden in the example which may be skipped while reading the problem description fast. I'd suggest emphasizing it a bit more in the description.

What do you think?

Tested, worked, clear.
I could only suggest to use another word than anagram for those who apparently reads only one word out of three.

I would love to have this one in reverse :D
For "Shortest word", can you explain to me why the output is 4 ? (i don't get it and i feel dumb tbh) ?

Anagram means literally swapping the letters around- so like "was" and "saw". The word "wassaw" would not be an anagram of "saw". Anagrams should have the same length, and same amount of each letter.

Also, even by your own rules, I don't see how the example has two outputs.
AALGORITHN, algorithmics, and beMithorgal all contain a letter not in the input (n,c, and b respectively), so how could the output be 2?

Edit 1: I like the puzzle, and will accept it when it is explained better. I did some thinking and realized you're looking for how much of the LINES are in w, not how much of the w is in LINES.
Edit 2: Well, nope, I tested my theory and it doesn't work out that way. Not sure what the pattern really is.

Shortest Word + Validator, doesn't seem right.

There is only one word each which is an anagram of the given single character, as 'cc' is not an anagram of 'c'.
String must not be an anagram, it must contain "hidden" anagram (it  means you can construct word using some letter from string). So word 'c' is hidden in string 'cc'

Calculate, how many of given strings have hidden INSIDE ANAGRAM OF FIRST WORD. 
If you don't understand, it's your fault
the anagram of "a" is "a" (in all words this letter is found)
Like with how many of the noisy inputs can you rebuild the key word...

Oh my bad, I had read "case sensitive." insteaf of  "case insensitive.". I was right, i'm dumb :^)
But thanks for your answer
String must not be an anagram, it must contain "hidden" anagram (it  means you can construct word using some letter from string). So word 'c' is hidden in string 'cc'
The one-line description isn't really clear to me either.  I think the sentence is not grammatically correct in English.

Literally uses improper English
Literally misuses the word anagram
my fault if I don't understand
lmao, okay buddy
